FuncDef:
The pim join-policy command enables an interface to filter join information in Join/Prune messages.
The undo pim join-policy command restores the default configuration. The pim join-policy command enables an interface to filter join information in Join/Prune messages. The undo pim join-policy command restores the default configuration. By default, an interface does not filter join information in Join/Prune messages.
CLIs: pim join-policy { <advanced-acl-number> | { acl-name <acl-name> } | { asm { <basic-acl-number> | acl-name <acl-name> } | ssm { <advanced-acl-number> | acl-name <acl-name> } } }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an advanced ACL.
The value is an integer that ranges from 3000 to 3999.

Specifies a named ACL for ASM.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

Specifies the name of a named ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

Enables an interface to filter join information of group addresses in the ASM address range.
-

Specifies a basic ACL for ASM.
The value is an integer that ranges from 2000 to 2999.

Enables an interface to filter join information sent by specified source addresses to group addresses in the SSM address range.
-

ExtraInfo: To protect a Router against Join/Prune message attacks, run the pim join-policy command to configure a join information filter policy by setting valid source and group address ranges for Join/Prune messages. The policy enables the Router to discard join information that does not match the specified filter policy.
